testimony.quarrel_subject: witness called the accused's son's actions inappropriate at a marriage feast; accused called witness a whore

witnesses.name: Jacot Girard Pechey
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor; wanted to marry accused when she was widowed

testimony.quarrel_subject: losses of animals blamed on accused
testimony.threat_quote: She told him he was 'un larron et meschant homme' (a thief and wicked man)

witnesses.name: Blaison Renolbin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: community member; employer of servants who worked for accused

harms_alleged.target: servants who went into her service

witnesses.name: Jehennon femme Lyenard Heriet
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor; had quarreled with accused's son

testimony.quarrel_subject: had quarreled with son of accused, did not invite accused to baptism

testimony.threat_quote: she said he might repent if he left

witnesses.name: Claudel Mengeon le Maimbourg
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: nephew (son of brother-in-law Mengeon le Maimbourg)

testimony.quarrel_subject: her animals escaped into his hayfield

witnesses.name: Jehennon, servante à Jacot Rolbé de Layegotte

timeline.subject: Jennon veuve Demenge Napuel
timeline.details: Substitut for PG asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jennon veuve Demenge Napuel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy rules she should only be threatened with torture unless accused by Claudatte femme Jean Claudel, when she should be given thumbscrews only

timeline.subject: Jennon veuve Demenge Napuel
timeline.details: Was shown thumbscrews and rack but continued to deny charges

timeline.subject: Jennon veuve Demenge Napuel
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to release

torture.restrictions: Only threatened with torture; if accused by Claudatte femme Jean Claudel, thumbscrews only

prior_accusations.accuser_name: moictrier of late escolatre of St Dié
prior_accusations.context: 11 or 12 years before current trial; arose because he had lost numerous animals and went to devin at Avould who told him losses came from his closest neighbors

prior_accusations.accuser_name: Claudatte fille Gregoire Mathis de Bertrimoutier
prior_accusations.context: Accused her when Jennon was in prison during first trial
Had confronted accused and 3 others before this trial and maintained allegations

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudatte fille Girard Jacot Pechey
notable_quotes.french: que c'estoit aussy bien à faire à elle, que son putier de fils, et s'elle vouloit dire qu'elle soit putain d'autre que de son fils, qu'elle avoit menty comme une sorciere
notable_quotes.context: Response to accused calling her a whore; witness had been seduced by accused's son under promise of marriage

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon veuve Demenge Napuel
notable_quotes.french: que quant a elle, elle n'est pas de la race des sorcieres, mais que ledit Cointzelin en est
notable_quotes.english: that as for her, she was not of the race of witches, but that said Cointzelin was
notable_quotes.context: Accused's response during interrogation; noted that Nicolas Cointzelin's uncle had been executed

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon veuve Demenge Napuel
notable_quotes.french: que l'on n'appelloit jamais une vache grebat, qu'elle n'en tienne des taches
notable_quotes.english: that one never called a cow spotted unless it had spots
notable_quotes.context: Remarking on execution of Barbeline, suggesting anyone called witch has some taint

relationships.evidence_text: First husband had been Jean Peteman of Raves, about 40 years before
brother and sister of Jacot Girard Pechey
she and her sister Jehennon (now married at Provencheres)
Claudel Mengeon le Maimbour had been her brother-in-law
they had acted as godparents to one another's children
his uncle, le maire Colas of Develine, had been executed
had been in her service for 2 years, 15 or 16 years earlier
his second wife Barbeline had been executed as witch

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox belonging to Jacot Girard Pechey
harms_catalog.harm_description: ox became very sick after wind blew through house; died within 2 hours

harms_catalog.victim_name: calf belonging to Jacot Girard Pechey

harms_catalog.harm_description: servants who went into her service soon became ill, although previously healthy, and had to leave

harms_catalog.victim_name: Jehennon femme Lyenard Heriet and baby
harms_catalog.harm_description: both witness and child became very ill after dream about accused
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel with accused's son; did not invite accused to baptism
harms_catalog.method_alleged: counter-magic with bread, salt, and ashes obtained from accused's servant reportedly cured them

harms_catalog.harm_description: mysterious fall with horse which rolled on him; spur stuck in belly of horse showing violence of fall but he was unhurt

harms_catalog.victim_name: two oxen belonging to Nicolas Cointzelin
harms_catalog.harm_description: killed by lightning without any visible injuries
sickened and died after drinking milk given by accused while helping repair her roof
became ill after leaving her service; for every day well had 6 or 7 weeks unable to work; illness lasted some 7 years

harms_catalog.victim_name: animals belonging to Colin Jean Magdelaine
harms_catalog.harm_description: lost more animals than he could remember after her release from first trial; had to sell property to move elsewhere
after drinking plate of milk his face became so hot he could hardly see; became all swollen and died after 18 weeks or more

harms_catalog.victim_name: 3 or 4 pigs belonging to Claude Jean Demenge Mengin
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: his animals had done damage to her property

harms_catalog.harm_description: died from 'un fil chancrée' which began next to mouth and consumed his lips
harms_catalog.method_alleged: allegedly gave him illness with an apple (according to additional testimony)

material_culture.context: allegedly given to victims causing illness/death
used as counter-magic by witness #5 to cure herself and child
allegedly used to give husband fatal illness
Jacot Girard Pechey took to her house after death of calf
what Jacot Girard Pechey said he would give Grand Prévôt
payment allegedly given to Claude Mengin by moictrier for testimony in first trial

spatial_references.context: primary location of trial and residence of accused
where accused had been taken on witchcraft charge in previous trial; where Barbeline was executed
home of Gregoire Mathis who confronted accused; origin of second husband
home of one of the other women confronted with Gregoire Mathis
home of wife of Jean du Prey, one of others confronted
where Claudel Mengeon le Maimbourg was working when called back for father's illness
where devin (diviner) lived who was consulted about animal losses
location Nicolas Cointzelin was returning from when he had mysterious fall
where le maire Colas (uncle of Nicolas Cointzelin) who was executed came from
origin of woman who lived in accused's ruined house

weather_events: lightning killing two oxen without visible injuries
animal_predation: large animal (like bear or 'grosse beste') allegedly seen by accused's children; big black animal in house
economic_hardship_indicators: Lyenard Heriet's family described as 'very poor'
Colin Jean Magdelaine had to sell property to move elsewhere due to losses

prior_legal_disputes.description: Jacot Girard Pechey started action against accused for calling him 'un larron et meschant homme' but friends advised difficulty proving; agreed to accord excluding charges from previous trial
Nicolas Cointzelin quarreled with accused's son at wedding feast of Claude Renouard, beating him and tearing off his collar
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: son took Cointzelin to court and won case

prior_legal_disputes.description: Claudatte fille Girard Jacot Pechey had long lawsuit claiming accused's son Claude fathered her bastard child and wanted him to marry her

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Should only be threatened with torture unless accused by Claudatte femme Jean Claudel, when she should be given thumbscrews only

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: held in prison from October 15 to November 26, 1609

hearsay_chains.content: accused gave milk to his father who was helping repair her roof, after which he sickened and died
story about death of father of Claudon Demenge Maimbourg after drinking milk
her son Claude had called accused witch 2 or 3 times
big black animal appeared in house and caressed her like a dog

emotional_state_notes: remained defiant, calling Nicolas Cointzelin a witch instead

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Jacot Girard Pechey had wanted to marry her when widowed; they had acted as godparents to each other's children
said Colas was 'un larron de poisson' (a fish thief)
said Nicolas Cointzelin lied like a witch and was of the race of witches; his uncle had been executed
claimed moictrier had given him 'un bichot de seigle' for testimony in first trial; said he was a man of no value
denied calling Claudatte a whore but noted she had bastard child; family did her great wrong about footsteps in snow because they had not obtained what they wanted from her

third_parties.name: Claude (son of accused)
third_parties.context: unmarried son; quarreled with various witnesses; Claudatte claimed he fathered her bastard child

third_parties.name: Claudatte (daughter of accused)
third_parties.context: married at Lubine; was marriageable when Colin Jean Magdelaine served accused

third_parties.name: Jehennon (sister of witness #1)
third_parties.context: married at Provencheres; present during ox death incident

third_parties.name: Bastien Grosmaire
third_parties.context: called in to calm Jacot Girard Pechey after ox death; Colin Jean Magdelaine later entered his service

third_parties.name: Claudon Demenge Maimbourg
third_parties.context: told Jean Renouard about his father's death after drinking accused's milk

third_parties.name: Mengeon le Maimbourg
third_parties.context: allegedly died after drinking plate of milk from accused; visited her frequently

third_parties.name: le maire Colas of Develine
third_parties.context: had been executed as witch

third_parties.name: Barbeline
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: second wife of Didier Anthoine Laurent
third_parties.context: executed as witch at St Dié some 5 years before; accused remarked on her execution

third_parties.name: woman from Burgundy
third_parties.context: weaver who lived in house owned by accused; saw big black animal; husband left her for another woman

third_parties.name: Jean Peteman
third_parties.context: of Raves; married about 40 years before; married for 17 years

third_parties.name: Demenge Napuel
third_parties.context: from Bertrimoutier; married 7.5 years; died from 'un fil chancrée' consuming his lips; allegedly said she gave him illness with apple

third_parties.name: moictrier of late escolatre of St Dié
third_parties.context: lost animals and consulted devin at Avould who blamed neighbors; initiated first trial

third_parties.name: devin at Avould
third_parties.context: diviner consulted by moictrier; said losses came from closest neighbors

third_parties.name: Gregoire Mathis
third_parties.context: of Bertrimoutier; confronted accused and 3 others; maintained allegations

third_parties.name: Claudatte fille Gregoire Mathis
third_parties.context: of Bertrimoutier; accused Jennon when she was in prison during first trial

third_parties.name: Claudatte femme Jean Claudel
third_parties.context: mentioned in Change de Nancy ruling; if she accused Jennon, thumbscrews could be used

third_parties.name: Claudatte femme Jean le Maimbourg
third_parties.context: of Raves; one of 3 others confronted with Gregoire Mathis

third_parties.name: Marie femme Andreu Gerardin
third_parties.context: of Combrimont; one of 3 others confronted with Gregoire Mathis

third_parties.name: wife of Jean du Prey
third_parties.context: of Frapelle; one of 3 others confronted with Gregoire Mathis

third_parties.name: Claude Renouard
third_parties.context: at his wedding feast Nicolas Cointzelin quarreled with accused's son

third_parties.name: Jean Colin Dieudonné
third_parties.context: went with Didier Anthoine Laurent to see Barbeline before execution

economic_context.details: Multiple witnesses mentioned quarrels over property damage by animals; accused owned house (now ruined) and had employed servants, suggesting middling economic status; Jacot Girard Pechey wanted to marry her when widowed, suggesting she had some property

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimony, interrogations, and appellate court involvement. Text damage noted in a few locations but overall very legible. This was accused's second trial; she was released from both. Notable for Change de Nancy's restrictive torture approval and ultimate recommendation for release.
